page.title: 15Benfleet - The Creek
page.content: The creek from Tewkes creek in the East to Haven creek in the West has many inlets,saltings and mud flats; where a wide variety of birds may be observed. The habitats are protected as a{Site of Special Scientific {Interest.}Birds such as black-headed gull,herons,swans,oyster-catchers, lapwings and terns are some of the species to be seen. Walks along the seawall either side of the creek show a wide variety of plant life from different habitats. Many different butterflies such as the brimstone,marbled-white,common blue, gatekeeper,ringlet,meadow brown, small copper and orange tip feed on the rich abundance of grasses,vetches and flowers. East of the flood barrier are moorings for yachts.Sailing is an important past time.
